alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 07 at 2:53AM PST until January 07 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding is expected around high tide due to a combination of high tides and very high river levels. * WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Coast. In Oregon, North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 8 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding, 1.5 to 2 feet above ground level, during high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The Toke Point total tide is forecasted to reach near 11.2 ft around 5 AM Friday. - The Astoria total tide is forecasted to reach near 11.4 ft around 5 AM Friday. - The Garibaldi total tide is forecasted to reach 10.4 ft around 5 AM Friday.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
